learning_outcomes.description: Identify the foundational professional behaviour, communication, and collaboration requirements of audiological practice, reflect on personal strengths and areas of development, and engage with feedback to ensure continuous improvement.
Adapt communication to meet the specific needs of each client, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and those from other culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.
Consider the culture and communication preferences of the Deaf community and identifies the need for an interpreter, where appropriate.
Explain the importance of person- and family-centred practices for the provision of effective audiological care.
Describe the workings of the Australian healthcare system (e.g., NDIS), including the range of professional roles in health-related settings.

Identify barriers that can impede or prevent access to services and resources by those with ear, hearing, and associated conditions; and strategies to advocate for and partner with people within these communities.
Identify strategies for raising the awareness of the communication needs of those who have, or are at risk of developing, ear, hearing, and associated conditions.

assessments.due_date:
23/02/2026 - 11/05/2026

The quiz takes place within the timetabled workshop between weeks 1 and 11.
assessments.task_description:
Students will be given a paper-and-pencil MCQ quiz about the online content for that week. The quiz is completed in person during each workshop. Only students who attend the workshop in person will be able to complete the quiz.

There are eleven quizzes (one for each of the workshops) over the course of the semester. Students will receive a mark of zero for any quizzes that are missed. The final grade for the quiz component will be based on the best nine quiz marks (out of a possible maximum of eleven).

Use of AI

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Using the 5R Reflective Framework, write a 2,000 word reflective essay that introduces your emerging professional identity as an audiologist and reflects on the content presented in this course. See the task description on Blackboard for a detailed explanation.

Use of AI

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit via the link on the Blackboard course site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
Written report 19/05/2026 2:00 pm

Presentations: during the workshops in week 12 / 13
assessments.category: Creative Production/ Exhibition, Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Product/ Design, Project
assessments.task_description:
Students will work in small groups to develop a plan to advocate for people with hearing problems, including background, rationale and design. This plan entails a written report and a presentation. Further details will be made available on the AUDL7112 Blackboard site.

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1. (Assessment Procedure (95)).

Use of AI

For the written report: Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. 

For the presentation: This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assignment item should be submitted via the Turn-it-in function on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
